trans-unit.source: Manage entities
trans-unit.target: Manage entities

trans-unit.source: Beginner Level designer
trans-unit.target: Beginner Level designer

trans-unit.source: To build the levels of your game, you need to translate (move), rotate, and resize entities in your scene. These are known as transformations.
trans-unit.target: To build the levels of your game, you need to translate (move), rotate, and resize entities in your scene. These are known as transformations.

trans-unit.source: Transformation gizmos
trans-unit.target: Transformation gizmos

trans-unit.source: You can select the transformation gizmos from Scene Editor toolbar.
trans-unit.target: You can select the transformation gizmos from Scene Editor toolbar.

trans-unit.source: Transformation gizmo toolbox
trans-unit.target: Transformation gizmo toolbox

trans-unit.source: Alternatively, press Space to switch between gizmos.
trans-unit.target: Alternatively, press Space to switch between gizmos.

trans-unit.source: There are three types of transformation gizmo:
trans-unit.target: There are three types of transformation gizmo:

trans-unit.source: Translation gizmo icon The translation gizmo moves entities
trans-unit.target: Translation gizmo icon The translation gizmo moves entities

trans-unit.source: Rotation gizmo icon The rotation gizmo rotates entities
trans-unit.target: Rotation gizmo icon The rotation gizmo rotates entities

trans-unit.source: Scale gizmo icon The scale gizmo resizes entities
trans-unit.target: Scale gizmo icon The scale gizmo resizes entities

trans-unit.source: Game Studio displays the selected transformation gizmo at the origin of the entity.
trans-unit.target: Game Studio displays the selected transformation gizmo at the origin of the entity.

trans-unit.source: Transformation gizmos in the scene
trans-unit.target: Transformation gizmos in the scene

trans-unit.source: Translation gizmo
trans-unit.target: Translation gizmo

trans-unit.source: To select the translation gizmo, click the Translation gizmo icon icon in the Scene Editor toolbar or press W.
trans-unit.target: To select the translation gizmo, click the Translation gizmo icon icon in the Scene Editor toolbar or press W.

trans-unit.source: The translation gizmo moves (translates) entities in the scene along the axis you select.
trans-unit.target: The translation gizmo moves (translates) entities in the scene along the axis you select.

trans-unit.source: To move an entity along the X axis, drag it by the red arrow.
trans-unit.target: To move an entity along the X axis, drag it by the red arrow.

trans-unit.source: To move an entity along the Y axis (up and down), drag it by the green arrow.
trans-unit.target: To move an entity along the Y axis (up and down), drag it by the green arrow.

trans-unit.source: To move the entity along the Z axis, drag it by the blue arrow.
trans-unit.target: To move the entity along the Z axis, drag it by the blue arrow.

trans-unit.source: To move the entity in free 3D, drag it by the central sphere.
trans-unit.target: To move the entity in free 3D, drag it by the central sphere.

trans-unit.source: Rotation gizmo
trans-unit.target: Rotation gizmo

trans-unit.source: To select the rotation gizmo, click the Rotation gizmo icon icon in the Scene Editor toolbar or press E.
trans-unit.target: To select the rotation gizmo, click the Rotation gizmo icon icon in the Scene Editor toolbar or press E.

trans-unit.source: The rotation gizmo rotates entities in the scene along the axis you select.
trans-unit.target: The rotation gizmo rotates entities in the scene along the axis you select.

trans-unit.source: To rotate an entity along the X axis (pitch), drag it by the red ring.
trans-unit.target: To rotate an entity along the X axis (pitch), drag it by the red ring.

trans-unit.source: To rotate an entity along the Y axis (yaw), drag it by the green ring.
trans-unit.target: To rotate an entity along the Y axis (yaw), drag it by the green ring.

trans-unit.source: To rotate the entity along the Z axis (roll), drag it by the blue ring.
trans-unit.target: To rotate the entity along the Z axis (roll), drag it by the blue ring.

trans-unit.source: Scale gizmo
trans-unit.target: Scale gizmo

trans-unit.source: To select the scale gizmo, click the Scale gizmo icon icon in the Scene Editor toolbar or press R.
trans-unit.target: To select the scale gizmo, click the Scale gizmo icon icon in the Scene Editor toolbar or press R.

trans-unit.source: The scale gizmo resizes entities along a single axis ("stretching" or "squashing" them) or all axes (making them larger or smaller without changing their proportions).
trans-unit.target: The scale gizmo resizes entities along a single axis ("stretching" or "squashing" them) or all axes (making them larger or smaller without changing their proportions).

trans-unit.source: To resize an entity along the X axis, drag it by the red ring.
trans-unit.target: To resize an entity along the X axis, drag it by the red ring.

trans-unit.source: To resize an entity along the Y axis, drag it by the green ring.
trans-unit.target: To resize an entity along the Y axis, drag it by the green ring.

trans-unit.source: To resize the entity along the Z axis, drag it by the blue ring.
trans-unit.target: To resize the entity along the Z axis, drag it by the blue ring.

trans-unit.source: To resize the entity in all axes, drag it by the central sphere.
trans-unit.target: To resize the entity in all axes, drag it by the central sphere.

trans-unit.source: !Note The scale gizmo only works with the local coordinate system (see below). When you select the scale gizmo, Game Studio switches to local coordinates.
trans-unit.target: !Note The scale gizmo only works with the local coordinate system (see below). When you select the scale gizmo, Game Studio switches to local coordinates.

trans-unit.source: Change gizmo coordinate system
trans-unit.target: Change gizmo coordinate system

trans-unit.source: You can change how the gizmo coordinates work.
trans-unit.target: You can change how the gizmo coordinates work.

trans-unit.source: Select the entity whose gizmo coordinates you want to change.
trans-unit.target: Select the entity whose gizmo coordinates you want to change.

trans-unit.source: In the Scene Editor toolbar, select the coordinate system you want.
trans-unit.target: In the Scene Editor toolbar, select the coordinate system you want.

trans-unit.source: Coordinate system
trans-unit.target: Coordinate system

trans-unit.source: Function
trans-unit.target: Function

trans-unit.source: World coordinates
trans-unit.target: World coordinates

trans-unit.source: World coordinates
trans-unit.target: World coordinates

trans-unit.source: Uses world coordinates for transformations. The X, Y, and Z axes are the same for every entity.
trans-unit.target: Uses world coordinates for transformations. The X, Y, and Z axes are the same for every entity.

trans-unit.source: Local coordinates
trans-unit.target: Local coordinates

trans-unit.source: Local coordinates
trans-unit.target: Local coordinates

trans-unit.source: Uses local coordinates for transformations. The axes are oriented in the same direction as the selected entity.
trans-unit.target: Uses local coordinates for transformations. The axes are oriented in the same direction as the selected entity.

trans-unit.source: Camera coordinates
trans-unit.target: Camera coordinates

trans-unit.source: Camera coordinates
trans-unit.target: Camera coordinates

trans-unit.source: Uses the current camera coordinates for transformations. The axes are oriented in the same direction as the editor camera.
trans-unit.target: Uses the current camera coordinates for transformations. The axes are oriented in the same direction as the editor camera.

trans-unit.source: Snap transformations to grid
trans-unit.target: Snap transformations to grid

trans-unit.source: You can "snap" transformations to the grid. This means that the degree of transformation you apply to entities is rounded to the closest multiple of the number you specify. For example, if you set the rotation snap value to 10, entities rotate in multiples of 10 (0, 10, 20, 30, etc).
trans-unit.target: You can "snap" transformations to the grid. This means that the degree of transformation you apply to entities is rounded to the closest multiple of the number you specify. For example, if you set the rotation snap value to 10, entities rotate in multiples of 10 (0, 10, 20, 30, etc).

trans-unit.source: You can change the snap values for each gizmo in the scene view toolbar. Snap values apply to all entities in the scene. For example:
trans-unit.target: You can change the snap values for each gizmo in the scene view toolbar. Snap values apply to all entities in the scene. For example:

trans-unit.source: Icon
trans-unit.target: Icon

trans-unit.source: Function
trans-unit.target: Function

trans-unit.source: Snap translation to multiple of 1
trans-unit.target: Snap translation to multiple of 1

trans-unit.source: Snap rotation to multiple of 22.5
trans-unit.target: Snap rotation to multiple of 22.5

trans-unit.source: Snap scale to multiple of 1.1
trans-unit.target: Snap scale to multiple of 1.1
